intro: Sebastiania longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces distinctive, fleshy, orange-red berries. Sebastiania longipes is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique fruiting structures.
